results.title: How Will the Suspended Bills-Bengals Game Be Resolved?
results.abstract: The N.F.L. has a number of options, none of them perfect, for how to handle competition for the last week of the regular season and the playoffs.

media.caption: Paycor Stadium in Cincinnati was the site of the suspended Bills-Bengals game.

results.adx_keywords: Royal Families;Books and Literature;Television;News and News Media;Harry, Duke of Sussex;Markle, Meghan;William, Duke of Cambridge;Charles III, King of the United Kingdom;CBS Corporation;ITV (TV Network);Great Britain
results.title: Britain Prepares for Another Installment in the Royal Family Drama
results.abstract: With Prince Harry’s new book, “Spare,” set to be released next week, Britain is gearing up for the release of revealing new interviews with the estranged royal.
per_facet: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

media.caption: Prince Harry and Prince William in September at the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II in London.
media.copyright: Andrew Testa for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Snow and Snowstorms;Traffic Accidents and Safety;Automobiles;Actors and Actresses;Renner, Jeremy;Marvel Entertainment;Paramount Pictures;Reno (Nev);Washoe County (Nev)
results.title: Jeremy Renner Was Run Over by 7-Ton Snow Plow, Authorities Say
results.abstract: The 51-year-old Marvel actor, who remained in a critical but stable condition on Tuesday, said in an Instagram post that he was “too messed up now to type,” but sent his love.

media.caption: Jeremy Renner at the premiere of the Marvel mini-series “Hawkeye” in Los Angeles in 2021.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Police;Chapin, Ethan (d 2022);Goncalves, Kaylee (d 2022);Kernodle, Xana (d 2022);Kohberger, Bryan C;Mogen, Madison (d 2022);University of Idaho;Washington State University;Idaho;Moscow (Idaho)
results.byline: By Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Mike Baker
results.title: Idaho Killings Suspect Got New License Plate Days After Murders
results.abstract: Records show the suspect’s Hyundai Elantra got a new registration in Washington State shortly after four students at the University of Idaho were murdered.

media.caption: Dashboard camera footage released by the Indiana State Police showed a trooper stopping Bryan Kohberger and his father on Dec. 15 for following a vehicle too closely.

results.adx_keywords: Murray, Patty;Senate
results.title: Senator Patty Murray is second in line to the presidency, for now.
results.abstract: The Washington State Democrat was elected president pro tempore of the Senate, which is normally third in line. But there is no speaker of the House yet.

media.caption: Senator Patty Murray, center, has served in the chamber for 30 years.
media.copyright: Anna Rose Layden for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Traffic Accidents and Safety;Deaths (Fatalities);Automobiles
results.byline: By Jenny Gross and McKenna Oxenden
results.title: Father Deliberately Drove Car Off Cliff, Authorities Say After Dramatic Rescue
results.abstract: Dharmesh A. Patel was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder and child abuse after his Tesla careened off a treacherous cliff in Northern California with him, his wife and two children inside, the authorities said.

media.caption: At the scene of the crash, off Highway 1 in Northern California on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);audio-neutral-informative;Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise, Clare Toeniskoetter, Luke Vander Ploeg, Marc Georges, Lisa Chow, Paige Cowett, Rowan Niemisto and Chris Wood
results.title: Inside Russia’s Military Catastrophe
results.abstract: As the war against Ukraine rolls on, it has become increasingly clear that this was not the Russian Army anyone expected.

results.adx_keywords: Firearms;Power Failures and Blackouts;Pierce County (Wash);Washington (State)
results.title: 2 Charged in Attacks on Substations in Washington State
results.abstract: One man told law enforcement officials that he and another person had planned to disrupt power in the area to commit a burglary, according to court documents. The attacks left thousands without power.

media.caption: Crews at an electrical substation in Graham, Wash., that was damaged early on Christmas morning.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Appointments and Executive Changes;Jeffries, Hakeem;Democratic Party;House of Representatives
results.title: Hakeem Jeffries Takes Over as Leader of House Democrats
results.abstract: A lawyer and disciplined tactician, Mr. Jeffries is the first Black politician to lead either party in Congress.

media.caption: Representative Hakeem Jeffries, 52, represents a generational change for House Democrats after two decades under Nancy Pelosi.
media.copyright: Shuran Huang for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Police;Utah;Enoch City (Utah)
results.byline: By Livia Albeck-Ripka and McKenna Oxenden
results.title: Family of 8, Including 5 Children, Found Shot to Death in Utah Home, Police Say
results.abstract: The Police Department in Enoch City, Utah, said officers had responded to the home for a welfare check on Wednesday. The authorities said they did not believe that any suspects were at large.

media.caption: A law enforcement official stands near the front door of the Enoch, Utah, home where eight people had been fatally shot.
media.copyright: Ben B. Braun/The Deseret News, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Cats;Pets;Animal Behavior;Animal Cognition;Research;your-feed-science;Animal Cognition (Journal)
results.title: Your Cat Might Not Be Ignoring You When You Speak
results.abstract: Cats have a reputation for being aloof, but a new study has found that their relationships with their owners may be stronger than we thought.

media.caption: Cats are often seen as aloof. But in a new study, they were not ignoring their owners, but instead “their reactions were very subtle,” the lead author of the study said.

results.adx_keywords: Football;Sports Injuries;Hamlin, Damar (1998- );Goodell, Roger;National Football League;Buffalo Bills;Cincinnati Bengals
results.byline: By Juliet Macur, Emmanuel Morgan and Jenny Vrentas
results.title: With Heavy Hearts, N.F.L. Players Go Back to Work
results.abstract: Many teams practiced on Wednesday, two days after Bills safety Damar Hamlin suffered a cardiac arrest during a game. He remained hospitalized, but a team statement noted “signs of improvement.”

media.caption: Mac Jones and his New England teammates warmed up during a practice on Wednesday in Foxborough, Mass.

results.adx_keywords: Gaetz, Matt;McCarthy, Kevin (1965- );House of Representatives
results.title: Gaetz, a McCarthy Foe, Accused Him of Squatting in the Speaker’s Office
results.abstract: The Florida Republican added insult to injury after McCarthy suffered a trio of defeats on the floor, sending a letter accusing him of illegally occupying the speaker’s office.

media.caption: “After three undeciding votes, no member can lay claim to this office,” Representative Matt Gaetz wrote in a letter to the architect of the Capitol.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Comedy and Humor;internal-sub-only
results.title: Stephen Colbert Is Thrilled Over Kevin McCarthy’s Troubles
results.abstract: “But remember, there’s more important things in life than winning or losing — there’s making fun of Kevin McCarthy for losing,” Colbert said.

media.caption: Stephen Colbert couldn’t keep from gloating over Representative Kevin McCarthy’s failure to become speaker of the House on Tuesday.

results.adx_keywords: Floods;Landslides and Mudslides;Rain;Weather;Rivers;Snow and Snowstorms;National Weather Service;California
results.byline: By Shawn Hubler, Soumya Karlamangla, Jacey Fortin and Jill Cowan
results.title: Powerful Storm Hits California, as Residents Brace for More Flooding
results.abstract: After several damaging storms swept through California in recent weeks, Gov. Gavin Newsom has declared a state of emergency amid another deluge.

media.caption: Highway traffic outside Santa Rosa, Calif., on Wednesday night.

results.title: Teen Stars of ‘Romeo and Juliet’ Sue Over Nudity in 1968 Film
results.abstract: Olivia Hussey and Leonard Whiting assert in a lawsuit that Paramount Pictures should have known nude images of them in their teens were “secretly and unlawfully obtained.”

media.caption: Olivia Hussey and Leonard Whiting in the 1968 film “Romeo and Juliet.”

results.adx_keywords: Hotels and Travel Lodgings;Family Business;Content Type: Personal Profile;Paul, Rita;Washington Square Hotel;Greenwich Village (Manhattan, NY)
results.title: At 13, She Fled the Nazis. At 95, She Runs a Storied Bohemian Hotel.
results.abstract: Dylan Thomas stayed there. So did Bob Dylan. And Rita Paul, its doyenne, welcomed them all.

media.caption: Rita Paul and her late husband purchased the Hotel Earle in Greenwich Village in 1973. It became a unique place in the annals of New York City’s eclectic art scene.
media.copyright: Sarah Blesener for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Orderliness and Clutter;Content Type: Service
results.title: Why We Clutter, and What to Do About It
results.abstract: All that “stuff” in our drawers, closets and corners is a hazard, but there are ways to keep it at bay.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Adams, Eric L;Police Department (NYC);Port Richmond (Staten Island, NY)
results.title: Police Officer Suspended After Video Shows Him Striking Teenage Girl
results.abstract: Mayor Eric Adams said that he watched the clip of the Staten Island clash and called the police commissioner. The officer was quickly suspended.

media.copyright: Gregg Vigliotti for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Layoffs and Job Reductions;Computers and the Internet;Labor and Jobs;Company Reports;Cloud Computing;Enterprise Computing;Benioff, Marc;Salesforce.com Inc
results.byline: By Isabella Simonetti and Kalley Huang
results.title: Salesforce to Lay Off 10% of Staff and Cut Office Space
results.abstract: The software company plans to cut around 8,000 jobs as business slows for tech companies. “We hired too many people leading into this economic downturn,” Salesforce’s chief executive said.

media.caption: Salesforce is laying off about 8,000 employees and cutting back on office space.
